hedline.hl1: Two Reaped Profit on Texas Soil

block.p: The business climate of Texas -- entrepreneurial, energy-based and big -- has been lucrative for both George W. Bush and his running mate, Dick Cheney.

For Mr. Bush, the sale of an ownership stake in the Texas Rangers baseball team netted a profit of $14.9 million two years ago, from an investment of $606,000 nine years before. And with a legendary Texas financier, Richard E. Rainwater, as his investment adviser, Mr. Bush has had investment income of more than $1 million a year in the last two years, in addition to his $115,345 salary as Texas governor.
The business climate of Texas -- entrepreneurial, energy-based and big -- has been lucrative for both George W. Bush and his running mate, Dick Cheney.

For Mr. Bush, the sale of an ownership stake in the Texas Rangers baseball team netted a profit of $14.9 million two years ago, from an investment of $606,000 nine years before. And with a legendary Texas financier, Richard E. Rainwater, as his investment adviser, Mr. Bush has had investment income of more than $1 million a year in the last two years, in addition to his $115,345 salary as Texas governor.

For Mr. Cheney, the numbers are even bigger. In 1995, when he became chief executive of the Halliburton Company, a Dallas oil services company, he received an annual salary and bonus of $1.3 million to $3 million, along with stock options and Halliburton shares.

According to documents filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Mr. Cheney owns 1,089,000 shares of Halliburton, including shares he owns outright and 860,000 options to purchase shares at a reduced price. With Halliburton trading at around $40 a share, his stake has a market value of around $40 million, although he would net somewhat less than that depending on the financial terms of the options.

Just this year, when Halliburton stock was trading at a 52-week high, Mr. Cheney sold 100,000 shares at $50.97 a share. That transaction, on May 31, took place just before Halliburton stock began to tumble.
